1.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

1.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
1.str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Last, at the last, finally, till the end. A superlative probably from echo; farthest, final.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
Perhaps from chalao through the idea of reducing the strength; difficult, i.e. Dangerous, or furious.
Fitting season, season, opportunity, occasion, time. Of uncertain affinity; an occasion, i.e. Set or proper time.

1.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
1.str2: From en and histemi; to place on hand, i.e. impend, be instant.

2.str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

2.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
2.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Self-loving, selfish. From philos and autos; fond of self, i.e. Selfish.
Money-loving, avaricious, covetous. From philos and arguros; fond of silver, i.e. Avaricious.
A boaster, one who gives one's self airs in a loud and flaunting way. From ale; braggart.
Proud, arrogant, disdainful. From huper and phaino; appearing above others, i.e. haughty.
Slanderous; subst: a blasphemer. From a derivative of blapto and pheme; scurrilious, i.e. Calumnious, or impious.
Unbelieving, disobedient, who will not be persuaded. Unpersuadable, i.e. Contumacious.
A begetter, father; plur: parents. From the base of ginomai; a parent.
Ungrateful, ungracious, unpleasing. Thankless, i.e. Ungrateful.

3.str2: Unloving, devoid of affection. Hard-hearted towards kindred.
Implacable, not to be bound by truce. Literally, without libation, i.e. truceless.
From diaballo; a traducer; specially, Satan.
Lacking self-control, powerless, inclined to excess. Powerless, i.e. Without self-control.
Not loving that which is good. Hostile to virtue.

4.str2: A betrayer, traitor. From prodidomi (the enemy's) hands); a surrender.
Impulsive, rash, reckless. From a compound of pro and pipto; falling forward, i.e. Headlong.

4.parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
4.str2: From a derivative of tupho; to envelop with smoke, i.e. to inflate with self-conceit.
Pleasure-loving. From philos and hedone; fond of pleasure, i.e. Voluptuous.
More, rather. Neuter of the comparative of the same as malista; more) or rather.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
Loving God. From philos and theos; fond of God, i.e. Pious.

5.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
5.str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Form, outline, semblance. From morphoo; formation, i.e., appearance (concretely) formula).
Piety (towards God), godliness, devotion, godliness. From eusebes; piety; specially, the gospel scheme.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

5.parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
5.str2: Perhaps from a and the middle voice of rheo; to contradict, i.e. Disavow, reject, abnegate.

5.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Singular
5.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From dunamai; force; specially, miraculous power.

5.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle - 2nd Person Singular
5.str2: To turn away from, shun. From apo and the base of trope; to deflect, i.e. avoid.

6.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
6.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

6.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
6.str2: To clothe; mid: I enter, creep into. From ennomos and duno; to sink (compare enduo) on, i.e. (figuratively) sneak.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From oikos; properly, residence, but usually an abode; by implication, a family.

6.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
6.str2: To take captive (in war); I subdue, ensnare. From aichmalotos; to make captive.
A woman, with all a woman's weakness, a poor weak woman, a silly woman. A diminutive from gune; a little woman.

6.parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Plural
6.str2: To heap up, load. From another form of soros; to pile up.

6.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Plural
6.str2: A primary verb; properly, to lead; by implication, to bring, drive, go, pass, or induce.
Various, of different colors, diverse, various. Of uncertain derivation; motley, i.e. Various in character.
Desire, eagerness for, inordinate desire, lust. From epithumeo; a longing.

7.str2: Always, at all times, ever. From pas and hote; every when, i.e. At all times.

7.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Plural
7.str2: Prolongation from a primary verb, another form of which, matheo, is used as an alternate in certain tenses; to learn.
Not at any time, never. From mede and pote; not even ever.

7.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Plural
7.str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From epiginosko; recognition, i.e. full discernment, acknowledgement.

8.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular

8.str2: Jannes, a sorcerer at the court of the Pharaoh. Of Egyptian origin; Jannes, an Egyptian.
Jambres, a sorcerer at the court of the Pharaoh. Of Egyptian origin; Jambres, an Egyptian.

8.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
8.str2: To set against; I withstand, resist, oppose. From anti and histemi; to stand against, i.e. Oppose.
Or Moses, or Mouses of Hebrew origin; Moseus, Moses, or Mouses, the Hebrew lawgiver.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

8.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
8.str2: To set against; I withstand, resist, oppose. From anti and histemi; to stand against, i.e. Oppose.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

8.parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
8.str2: To destroy, corrupt. From kata and phtheiro; to spoil entirely, i.e. to destroy; or to deprave.
Probably from the base of ginosko; the intellect, i.e. Mind; by implication, meaning.
Failing to pass the test, unapproved, counterfeit. By implication, worthless.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

9.str2: But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

9.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
9.str2: From pro and kopto; to drive forward, i.e. to advance.
Or neuter pleion, or pleon comparative of polus; more in quantity, number, or quality; also the major portion.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.

9.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
9.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Folly, madness, foolishness. From a compound of a and nous; stupidity; by implication, rage.

9.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
9.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Perfectly evident, manifest. From ek and delos; wholly evident.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

10.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Singular
10.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

10.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
10.str2: From para and akoloutheo; to follow near, i.e. attend, trace out, conform to.

10.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
10.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From protithemai; a setting forth, i.e. proposal; specially, the show-bread as exposed before God.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Patience, forbearance, longsuffering. From the same as makrothumos; longanimity, i.e. forbearance or fortitude.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Endurance, steadfastness, patient waiting for. From hupomeno; cheerful endurance, constancy.

Chase, pursuit; persecution. From dioko; persecution.

From a presumed derivative of pathos; something undergone, i.e. Hardship or pain; subjectively, an emotion or influence.

11.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Plural
11.str2: Probably akin to ho, hos, and hosos; such or what sort of; especially the neuter with negative, not so.

11.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
11.str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

11.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
11.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From Antiochus; Antiochia, a place in Syria.
Perhaps from eikon; image-like; Iconium, a place in Asia Minor.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Lystra, a place in Asia Minor.

Chase, pursuit; persecution. From dioko; persecution.

11.str2: To bear up under, endure, suffer. From hupo and phero; to bear from underneath, i.e. to undergo hardship.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

11.str2: To rescue, deliver (from danger or destruction).

From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

Piously, religiously. Adverb from eusebes; piously.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

12.str2: To pursue, hence: I persecute. A prolonged form of a primary verb dio; to pursue; by implication, to persecute.

13.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
A conjuror, juggler, sorcerer; a tricky (crafty) deceiver, imposter. From goao; properly, a wizard, i.e. an imposter.

13.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
13.str2: From pro and kopto; to drive forward, i.e. to advance.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Worse, more severe. Irregular comparative of kakos; from an obsolete equivalent cheres; more evil or aggravated.

13.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
13.str2: To lead astray, deceive, cause to wander. From plane; to roam.

Profitable, beneficial, useful. From a form of ophelos; helpful or serviceable, i.e. Advantageous.
